text: Howard Wallace Pollock (April 11, 1920 in Chicago, Illinois - January 9, 2011 in Coronado, Colorado) was an American politician of the Republican Party. He was a member of the United States House of Representatives for Alaska from 1967 to 1971. He was also a member of the Alaska Senate from 1961 to 1963. and from 1965 to 1966. During World War II Pollock was a lieutenant commander in the United States Navy. == References == * 100years.akleg.gov Category:1920 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:United States representatives from Alaska Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Military people from Chicago
title: Howard Wallace Pollock
